name: Thymeleaf
short_description: Serve HTML content using Thymeleaf template engine

documentation.description: Ktor includes support for `Thymeleaf` templates through the Thymeleaf plugin.
documentation.usage:
Initialize the `Thymeleaf` plugin with a `ClassLoaderTemplateResolver`: ```kotlin install(Thymeleaf) { setTemplateResolver(ClassLoaderTemplateResolver().apply { prefix = "templates/" suffix = ".html" characterEncoding = "utf-8" }) } ``` This TemplateResolver sets up Thymeleaf to look for the template files on the classpath in the "templates" package, relative to the current class path. A basic template looks like this: ```html

Your email address is

``` With that template in `resources/templates` it is accessible elsewhere in the the application using the `call.respond()` method: ```kotlin data class User(val name: String, val email: String) get("/") { val user = User("user name", "user@example.com") call.respond(ThymeleafContent("hello", mapOf("user" to user))) } ```

templates.text: data class ThymeleafUser(val id: Int, val name: String)
